top_procedures.description: Removal and microscopic examination of growth of the head, neck, hands, feet, or genitals (first stage, up to 5 tissue blocks)
Relocation of patient skin to nose, ears, eyelids, and/or lips (20 sq centimeters or less)
Removal and microscopic examination of growth of the head, neck, hands, feet, or genitals
Relocation of patient skin to forehead, cheeks, chin, mouth, neck, underarms, genitals, hands, and/or feet (20 sq centimeters or less)

Established patient office or other outpatient visit, typically 15 minutes
Tissue transfer repair of wound (10.1 to 30.0 sq centimeters) of the forehead, cheeks, chin, mouth, neck, underarms, genitals, hands, and/or feet

Tissue transfer repair of wound (10 sq centimeters or less) of eyelids, nose, ears, and/or lips
Established patient office or other outpatient visit, typically 10 minutes
Repair of wound (2.6 to 7.5 centimeters) of scalp, arms, and/or legs

New patient office or other outpatient visit, typically 20 minutes
Repair of wound of scalp, arms, and/or legs
Repair of wound (2.6 to 7.5 centimeters) of the scalp, underarms, trunk, arms, and/or legs
Established patient office or other outpatient visit, typically 5 minutes
Skin application of tar and ultraviolet B or petrolatum and ultraviolet B
